messages.title: WE'VE COME A LONG WAY SINCE 2010
messages.content: Five years ago, the Labour Minister in charge of spending taxpayers' money left a note saying: 'I'm afraid there is no money'. Five years on, Britain is now one of the fastest growing major economies in the world. We are getting our national finances back under control. We have halved our deficit as a share of our economy. More people are in work than ever before.

messages.title: ED MILIBAND AND THE SNP WILL COST YOU
messages.content:
Ed Miliband would lead a weak and chaotic government. And this isn’t just because he and Labour haven’t learnt any lessons on the economy since leaving behind that note five years ago.

The most troubling reality of Mr. Miliband is that the only way he can become Prime Minister is with the backing of the Scottish National Party – giving Nicola Sturgeon and Alex Salmond an effective veto over anything the UK Prime Minister does.

issues.economy: Britain is now one of the fastest growing major economies in the world. We are getting our national finances back under control. We have halved our deficit as a share of our economy.

images.caption: Rt Hon David Cameron Prime Minister
